page.title: 18Poringland History
page.content: In 1086 a freeman held 12 acres.There were also 6 slaves,3 ploughs, some woodland,40 pigs,2 acres meadow,4 head of cattle,80 sheep. Many villagers worked on the land or owned very little. 12 acres was worth 40 shillings.Plus tax at 12d.The first date of the church in Poringland was Norman.Since then it has hardly changed. The stained glass windows are medival. The registers of baptisms, marriages and burials date from 1560. An e.g. '1666 Robert Pratt the miller kill'd by a fall from the mill sails was buried.' Also 20 shillings 4d. collected for ransom of slaves in Turkey. One prominent family during this time the Cursons who owned Blackford Hall. Mary Tudor gained her strongest support from this area. By 1863 a range of trades was practised, e.g. carpenter, 3 policeman, engineer.
